lldpXHmMIB.name: lldpXHmMIB

revisions.description: Part of Hirschmann LLDP device information extension

lldpXHmMIB.contactinfo: Postal: Stuttgarter Str. 45-51 72654 Neckartenzlingen Germany Phone: +49 7127 140 E-mail: hac.support@belden.com
lldpXHmMIB.description: The LLDP Management Information Base extension module for Hirschmann organizationally defined discovery information. In order to assure the uniqueness of the LLDP-MIB, lldpXHmMIB is branched from lldpExtensions using the Hirschmann OUI value as the node. Copyright (C) 2008. All Rights Reserved.

LldpXHmLocGMRPServiceReqSyntax.name: LldpXHmLocGMRPServiceReqSyntax
LldpXHmLocGMRPServiceReqSyntax.description: (1) corresponds to forward All Multicast Groups requirement (2) corresponds to forward Unregistered Multicast Groups requirement (3) not applicable If GMRP is not configured on the interface, the value should be set to 3 and the field should not be evaluated.

LldpXHmLocIGMPVersionSyntax.name: LldpXHmLocIGMPVersionSyntax
LldpXHmLocIGMPVersionSyntax.description: This bitmap shows which IGMP version is configured on the local device: Bit(0): a 1 indicates IGMPv1 configured. Bit(1): a 1 indicates IGMPv2 configured. Bit(2): a 1 indicates IGMPv2 configured. All IGMP Versions are mutually exclusive, so only one bit should be set at any given time. If all bits are set to 0, IGMP is not configured on the device.

LldpXHmLocPortSecModeSyntax.name: LldpXHmLocPortSecModeSyntax
LldpXHmLocPortSecModeSyntax.description: This Integer Value Shows the 802.1X Port Security configuration for a local port: (1) not applicable, no 802.1X support or not configured (2) force Authorized, general port access without authorization (3) force Unauthorized, no general port access, even with autorization (4) automatic, access based on successful authorization (5) mac Based, access based on successful authorization for each client (MAC)

LldpXHmLocPTPSupportSyntax.name: LldpXHmLocPTPSupportSyntax
LldpXHmLocPTPSupportSyntax.description: This bitmap shows which PTP versions are supported by the local system, based on installed hardware: Bit(0): a 1 indicates that PTP is supported in software only Bit(1): a 1 indicates that PTPv1 is supported Bit(2): a 1 indicates that PTPv2 is supported Bit(3): a 1 indicates that PTPTC is supported PTPTC indicates the capability to act as a PTP transparent clock. If no bits are set, the device does not support any PTP standard and all following fields should be set to (0) or (not applicable).

LldpXHmLocPTPStatusSyntax.name: LldpXHmLocPTPStatusSyntax
LldpXHmLocPTPStatusSyntax.description: This bitmap shows which PTP versions are enabled on the local system: Bit(0): a 1 indicates that PTPv1 is enabled Bit(1): a 1 indicates that PTPv2 is enabled Both bits should not be set simultaneously, as either only PTPv1 or PTPv2 can be enabled on a device. If no bits are set, no PTP standard is enabled on the port/device and all following fields should be set to (0) or similar (e.g. not applicable).

LldpXHmLocPTPv2DataTransferSyntax.name: LldpXHmLocPTPv2DataTransferSyntax
LldpXHmLocPTPv2DataTransferSyntax.description: This Integer is only viable if PTPv2 is enabled. It shows the data transfer type configured on the local port and device. If only PTPv1 is enabled or no PTP available, this should be set to 4 and not evaluated.

LldpXHmLocPTPv2DelayMechanismSyntax.name: LldpXHmLocPTPv2DelayMechanismSyntax
LldpXHmLocPTPv2DelayMechanismSyntax.description: This Integer is only viable if PTPv2 is enabled. It shows the delay mechanism configured on the local port and device. If only PTPv1 is enabled or no PTP available, this should be set to 4 and not evaluated.

LldpXHmRemGMRPServiceReqSyntax.name: LldpXHmRemGMRPServiceReqSyntax
LldpXHmRemGMRPServiceReqSyntax.description: (1) corresponds to forward All Multicast Groups requirement (2) corresponds to forward Unregistered Multicast Groups requirement If GMRP is not configured on the interface, the value should be set to 3 and the field should not be evaluated.

LldpXHmRemPTPv2DataTransferSyntax.name: LldpXHmRemPTPv2DataTransferSyntax
LldpXHmRemPTPv2DataTransferSyntax.description: This field is only viable if PTPv2 is enabled. It shows the data transfer type configured on the remote port and device. If only PTPv1 is enabled or no PTP available, this should be set to 4 and not evaluated.

LldpXHmRemPTPv2DelayMechanismSyntax.name: LldpXHmRemPTPv2DelayMechanismSyntax
LldpXHmRemPTPv2DelayMechanismSyntax.description: This field is only viable if PTPv2 is enabled. It shows the delay mechanism configured on the remote port and device. If only PTPv1 is enabled or no PTP available, this should be set to 4 and not evaluated.

LldpXHmRemPTPSupportSyntax.name: LldpXHmRemPTPSupportSyntax
LldpXHmRemPTPSupportSyntax.description: This bitmap shows which PTP versions are supported by the remote system, based on installed hardware: Bit(0): a 1 indicates that PTP is supported in software only Bit(1): a 1 indicates that PTPv1 is supported Bit(2): a 1 indicates that PTPv2 is supported Bit(3): a 1 indicates that PTPTC is supported PTPTC indicates the capability to act as a PTP transparent clock. If no bits are set, the device does not support any PTP standard and all following fields should be set to (0) or (not applicable).

LldpXHmRemPTPStatusSyntax.name: LldpXHmRemPTPStatusSyntax
LldpXHmRemPTPStatusSyntax.description: This Bitmap shows which PTP versions are enabled on the remote system: Bit(0): a 1 indicates that PTPv1 is enabled Bit(1): a 1 indicates that PTPv2 is enabled Both bits should not be set simultaneously, as either only PTPv1 or PTPv2 can be enabled on a device. If no bits are set, no PTP standard is enabled on the port/device and all following fields should be set to (0) or similar (e.g. not applicable).

LldpXHmRemPortSecModeSyntax.name: LldpXHmRemPortSecModeSyntax
LldpXHmRemPortSecModeSyntax.description: This Integer Value Shows the 802.1X Port Security configuration for a remote port: (1) not applicable, no 802.1X support or not configured (2) force Authorized, general port access without authorization (3) force Unauthorized, no general port access, even with autorization (4) automatic, access based on successful authorization

LldpXHmRemIGMPVersionSyntax.name: LldpXHmRemIGMPVersionSyntax
LldpXHmRemIGMPVersionSyntax.description: Shows which IGMP version is configured on the remote device: Bit(0): a 1 indicates IGMPv1 configured. Bit(1): a 1 indicates IGMPv2 configured. Bit(2): a 1 indicates IGMPv2 configured. All IGMP Versions are mutually exclusive, so only one bit should be set to 1 at any given time. If all bits are set to 0, IGMP is not configured on the device.

lldpXHmConfigGMRPTable.name: lldpXHmConfigGMRPTable
lldpXHmConfigGMRPTable.description: A table that controls GMRP LLDP TLV Information to be transmitted on individual ports.

lldpXHmConfigGMRPEntry.name: lldpXHmConfigGMRPEntry
lldpXHmConfigGMRPEntry.description: LLDP configuration information that controls the transmission of Hirschmann GMRP organizationally defined Configuration TLV on LLDP transmission capable ports. This configuration object augments the lldpPortConfigEntry of the LLDP-MIB, therefore it is only present along with the port configuration defined by the associated lldpPortConfigEntry entry. Each active lldpConfigEntry must be restored from non-volatile storage (along with the corresponding lldpPortConfigEntry) after a re-initialization of the management system.

lldpXHmConfigGMRPTxEnable.name: lldpXHmConfigGMRPTxEnable
lldpXHmConfigGMRPTxEnable.description: The lldpXHmConfigGMRPTxEnable, which is defined as a truth value and configured by the network management, determines whether the Hirschmann GMRP organizationally defined port TLV transmission is allowed on a given LLDP transmission capable port. The value of this object must be restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system.

lldpXHmConfigIGMPTable.name: lldpXHmConfigIGMPTable
lldpXHmConfigIGMPTable.description: A table that controls IGMP LLDP TLV Information to be transmitted on individual ports.

lldpXHmConfigIGMPEntry.name: lldpXHmConfigIGMPEntry
lldpXHmConfigIGMPEntry.description: LLDP configuration information that controls the transmission of Hirschmann IGMP organizationally defined Configuration TLV on LLDP transmission capable ports. This configuration object augments the lldpPortConfigEntry of the LLDP-MIB, therefore it is only present along with the port configuration defined by the associated lldpPortConfigEntry entry. Each active lldpConfigEntry must be restored from non-volatile storage (along with the corresponding lldpPortConfigEntry) after a re-initialization of the management system.

lldpXHmConfigIGMPTxEnable.name: lldpXHmConfigIGMPTxEnable
lldpXHmConfigIGMPTxEnable.description: The lldpXHmConfigIGMPTxEnable, which is defined as a truth value and configured by the network management, determines whether the Hirschmann IGMP organizationally defined port TLV transmission is allowed on a given LLDP transmission capable port. The value of this object must be restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system.

lldpXHmConfigPortSecTable.name: lldpXHmConfigPortSecTable
lldpXHmConfigPortSecTable.description: A table that controls 802.1X Port Security LLDP TLV Information to be transmitted on individual ports.

lldpXHmConfigPortSecEntry.name: lldpXHmConfigPortSecEntry
lldpXHmConfigPortSecEntry.description: LLDP configuration information that controls the transmission of Hirschmann 802.1X Port Security organizationally defined Configuration TLV on LLDP transmission capable ports. This configuration object augments the lldpPortConfigEntry of the LLDP-MIB, therefore it is only present along with the port configuration defined by the associated lldpPortConfigEntry entry. Each active lldpConfigEntry must be restored from non-volatile storage (along with the corresponding lldpPortConfigEntry) after a re-initialization of the management system.

lldpXHmConfigPortSecTxEnable.name: lldpXHmConfigPortSecTxEnable
lldpXHmConfigPortSecTxEnable.description: The lldpXHmConfigPortSecTxEnable, which is defined as a truth value and configured by the network management, determines whether the Hirschmann 802.1X Port Security organizationally defined port TLV transmission is allowed on a given LLDP transmission capable port. The value of this object must be restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system.

lldpXHmConfigPTPTable.name: lldpXHmConfigPTPTable
lldpXHmConfigPTPTable.description: A table that controls PTP LLDP TLV Information to be transmitted on individual ports.

lldpXHmConfigPTPEntry.name: lldpXHmConfigPTPEntry
lldpXHmConfigPTPEntry.description: LLDP configuration information that controls the transmission of Hirschmann PTP organizationally defined Configuration TLV on LLDP transmission capable ports. This configuration object augments the lldpPortConfigEntry of the LLDP-MIB, therefore it is only present along with the port configuration defined by the associated lldpPortConfigEntry entry. Each active lldpConfigEntry must be restored from non-volatile storage (along with the corresponding lldpPortConfigEntry) after a re-initialization of the management system.

lldpXHmConfigPTPTxEnable.name: lldpXHmConfigPTPTxEnable
lldpXHmConfigPTPTxEnable.description: The lldpXHmConfigPTPTxEnable, which is defined as a truth value and configured by the network management, determines whether the Hirschmann PTP organizationally defined port TLV transmission is allowed on a given LLDP transmission capable port. The value of this object must be restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system.

lldpXHmLocGMRPTable.name: lldpXHmLocGMRPTable
lldpXHmLocGMRPTable.description: This table contains one or more rows per Port and GMRP information about each port of the local system. GMRP is a protocol used for constraining IP Multicast traffic defined by the IEEE in standard 802.1p, published in standard 802.1D

lldpXHmLocGMRPEntry.name: lldpXHmLocGMRPEntry
lldpXHmLocGMRPEntry.description: GMRP Information about a particular port component.

lldpXHmLocGMRPSupport.name: lldpXHmLocGMRPSupport
lldpXHmLocGMRPSupport.description: The truth value used to indicate whether the given port (associated with the local system) supports GMRP. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmLocGMRPStatus.name: lldpXHmLocGMRPStatus
lldpXHmLocGMRPStatus.description: The truth value used to indicate whether GMRP is enabled on the the given port associated with the local system. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmLocGMRPServiceReq.name: lldpXHmLocGMRPServiceReq
lldpXHmLocGMRPServiceReq.description: Integer value, used to indicate which GMRP service requirement is enabled on the the given port associated with the local system.

lldpXHmLocIGMPTable.name: lldpXHmLocIGMPTable
lldpXHmLocIGMPTable.description: This table contains one or more rows per Port and IGMP information about each port of the local system. IGMP is a protocol used for constraining IP multicast traffic specified in IETF RFCs 1112, 2236(IGMPv2) and 3376(IGMPv3)

lldpXHmLocIGMPEntry.name: lldpXHmLocIGMPEntry
lldpXHmLocIGMPEntry.description: IGMP Information about a particular port component.

lldpXHmLocIGMPSupport.name: lldpXHmLocIGMPSupport
lldpXHmLocIGMPSupport.description: The truth value used to indicate whether the given port (associated with the local system) supports IGMP. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmLocIGMPStatus.name: lldpXHmLocIGMPStatus
lldpXHmLocIGMPStatus.description: The truth value used to indicate whether IGMP is enabled on the the given port associated with the local system. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmLocIGMPVersion.name: lldpXHmLocIGMPVersion
lldpXHmLocIGMPVersion.description: This bitmap shows which IGMP version is configured on the local device.

lldpXHmLocPortSecTable.name: lldpXHmLocPortSecTable
lldpXHmLocPortSecTable.description: This table contains one or more rows per Port and 802.1X Port Security information about each port of the local system. IEEE 802.1X Port Security is a standard, defining rules for a port based network access control with a client/supplicant requesting access to the network from an authenticator/RADIUS server

lldpXHmLocPortSecEntry.name: lldpXHmLocPortSecEntry
lldpXHmLocPortSecEntry.description: 802.1X Port Security Information about a particular port component.

lldpXHmLocPortSecSupport.name: lldpXHmLocPortSecSupport
lldpXHmLocPortSecSupport.description: The truth value used to indicate whether the given port (associated with the local system) supports 802.1X Port Security. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmLocPortSecStatus.name: lldpXHmLocPortSecStatus
lldpXHmLocPortSecStatus.description: The truth value used to indicate whether 802.1X Port Security is enabled on the the given port associated with the local system. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmLocPortSecMode.name: lldpXHmLocPortSecMode
lldpXHmLocPortSecMode.description: This Integer value contains informations about a local ports 802.1X configuration.

lldpXHmLocPTPTable.name: lldpXHmLocPTPTable
lldpXHmLocPTPTable.description: This table contains one or more rows per Port and PTP information about the local system. The Precision Time Protocol (PTP) is defined in IEEE Standard 1588 and describes a protocol for network (system) clock synchronization with very high precision.

lldpXHmLocPTPEntry.name: lldpXHmLocPTPEntry
lldpXHmLocPTPEntry.description: Port and PTP Information about a particular port component

lldpXHmLocPTPSupport.name: lldpXHmLocPTPSupport
lldpXHmLocPTPSupport.description: This bitmap shows which PTP versions are supported by the local system, based on installed hardware

lldpXHmLocPTPStatus.name: lldpXHmLocPTPStatus
lldpXHmLocPTPStatus.description: This bitmap shows which PTP versions are enabled on the local system

lldpXHmLocPTPSyncInterval.name: lldpXHmLocPTPSyncInterval
lldpXHmLocPTPSyncInterval.description: This Integer shows the PTPv1 and PTPv2 Synchronization Interval. If no PTP is available or configured, this value should be set to -128.

lldpXHmLocPTPv2AnnounceInterval.name: lldpXHmLocPTPv2AnnounceInterval
lldpXHmLocPTPv2AnnounceInterval.description: This Integer shows the PTPv2 Announce Interval. If PTPv2 is not configured or available, this should be set to -128.

lldpXHmLocPTPv2DataTransfer.name: lldpXHmLocPTPv2DataTransfer
lldpXHmLocPTPv2DataTransfer.description: This Integer shows the enabled PTPv2 data transfer method.

lldpXHmLocPTPv2DelayMechanism.name: lldpXHmLocPTPv2DelayMechanism
lldpXHmLocPTPv2DelayMechanism.description: This Integer shows the enabled PTPv2 delay mechanism

lldpXHmLocPTPClockValues.name: lldpXHmLocPTPClockValues
lldpXHmLocPTPClockValues.description: This bitmap shows, which clock type(s) are configured on a specific port and/or device: Bit (0) set to 1 indicates a slave clock Bit (1) set to 1 indicates a master clock Bit (2) set to 1 indicates a transparent clock Bit (3) set to 1 indicates a boundary clock Bit (4) set to 1 indicates a grandmaster clock Bit (5) set to 1 indicates a clock in multi domain mode Bit (6) set to 1 indicates a clock in simple mode If no PTP is configured, all bits should be set to 0.

lldpXHmLocPTPv2SubdomainNumber.name: lldpXHmLocPTPv2SubdomainNumber
lldpXHmLocPTPv2SubdomainNumber.description: This Integer shows the PTPv2 subdomain number configured on the local device. In case PTPv1 is configured, this value is of no relevance and will not be evaluated.

lldpXHmLocPTPv1SubdomainName.name: lldpXHmLocPTPv1SubdomainName
lldpXHmLocPTPv1SubdomainName.description: This Octet String contains the PTPv1 subdomain name, an ASCII String with a maximum of 16 characters length, configured on the local device. If PTPv2 or no PTP is configured, this should be set to 0.

lldpXHmRemGMRPTable.name: lldpXHmRemGMRPTable
lldpXHmRemGMRPTable.description: This table contains one or more rows per Port and GMRP information about the remote system. GMRP is a protocol used for constraining IP Multicast traffic defined by the IEEE in standard 802.1p, published in standard 802.1D

lldpXHmRemGMRPEntry.name: lldpXHmRemGMRPEntry
lldpXHmRemGMRPEntry.description: GMRP Information about a particular port component.

lldpXHmRemGMRPSupport.name: lldpXHmRemGMRPSupport
lldpXHmRemGMRPSupport.description: The truth value used to indicate whether the given port (associated with the remote system) supports GMRP. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmRemGMRPStatus.name: lldpXHmRemGMRPStatus
lldpXHmRemGMRPStatus.description: The truth value used to indicate whether GMRP is enabled on the the given port associated with the remote system. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmRemGMRPServiceReq.name: lldpXHmRemGMRPServiceReq
lldpXHmRemGMRPServiceReq.description: Integer value, used to indicate which GMRP service requirement is enabled on the the given port associated with the remote system.

lldpXHmRemIGMPTable.name: lldpXHmRemIGMPTable
lldpXHmRemIGMPTable.description: This table contains one or more rows per Port and IGMP information about each port of the remote system. IGMP is a protocol used for constraining IP multicast traffic specified in IETF RFCs 1112, 2236(IGMPv2) and 3376(IGMPv3)

lldpXHmRemIGMPEntry.name: lldpXHmRemIGMPEntry
lldpXHmRemIGMPEntry.description: IGMP Information about a particular port component.

lldpXHmRemIGMPSupport.name: lldpXHmRemIGMPSupport
lldpXHmRemIGMPSupport.description: The truth value used to indicate whether the given port (associated with the remote system) supports IGMP. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmRemIGMPStatus.name: lldpXHmRemIGMPStatus
lldpXHmRemIGMPStatus.description: The truth value used to indicate whether IGMP is enabled on the the given port associated with the remote system. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmRemIGMPVersion.name: lldpXHmRemIGMPVersion
lldpXHmRemIGMPVersion.description: This bitmap shows which IGMP version is configured on the remote device.

lldpXHmRemPortSecTable.name: lldpXHmRemPortSecTable
lldpXHmRemPortSecTable.description: This table contains one or more rows per Port and 802.1X Port Security information about each port of the remote system. IEEE 802.1X Port Security is a standard, defining rules for a port based network access control with a client/supplicant requesting access to the network from an authenticator/RADIUS server

lldpXHmRemPortSecEntry.name: lldpXHmRemPortSecEntry
lldpXHmRemPortSecEntry.description: 802.1X Port Security Information about a particular port component.

lldpXHmRemPortSecSupport.name: lldpXHmRemPortSecSupport
lldpXHmRemPortSecSupport.description: The truth value used to indicate whether the given port (associated with the remote system) supports 802.1X Port Security. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmRemPortSecStatus.name: lldpXHmRemPortSecStatus
lldpXHmRemPortSecStatus.description: The truth value used to indicate whether 802.1X Port Security is enabled on the the given port associated with the remote system. If this is set to (false), all following fields should be set to not applicable and should not be evaluated.

lldpXHmRemPortSecMode.name: lldpXHmRemPortSecMode
lldpXHmRemPortSecMode.description: This Integer value contains informations about a remote ports 802.1X configuration.

lldpXHmRemPTPTable.name: lldpXHmRemPTPTable
lldpXHmRemPTPTable.description: This table contains one or more rows per Port and PTP information about the remote system. The Precision Time Protocol (PTP) is defined in IEEE Standard 1588 and describes a protocol for network (system) clock synchronization with very high precision.

lldpXHmRemPTPEntry.name: lldpXHmRemPTPEntry
lldpXHmRemPTPEntry.description: Port and PTP Information about a particular port component

lldpXHmRemPTPSupport.name: lldpXHmRemPTPSupport
lldpXHmRemPTPSupport.description: Shows which PTP versions are supported by the remote system, based on installed hardware

lldpXHmRemPTPStatus.name: lldpXHmRemPTPStatus
lldpXHmRemPTPStatus.description: Shows which PTP versions are enabled on the remote system

lldpXHmRemPTPSyncInterval.name: lldpXHmRemPTPSyncInterval
lldpXHmRemPTPSyncInterval.description: Shows the PTPv1 and PTPv2 Synchronization Interval. If no PTP is available or configured, this value should be set to -128.

lldpXHmRemPTPv2AnnounceInterval.name: lldpXHmRemPTPv2AnnounceInterval
lldpXHmRemPTPv2AnnounceInterval.description: Shows the PTPv2 Announce Interval. If PTPv2 is not configured or available, this should be set to -128.

lldpXHmRemPTPv2DataTransfer.name: lldpXHmRemPTPv2DataTransfer
lldpXHmRemPTPv2DataTransfer.description: This field is only viable if PTPv2 is enabled. It shows the data transfer type configured on the remote port and device.

lldpXHmRemPTPv2DelayMechanism.name: lldpXHmRemPTPv2DelayMechanism
lldpXHmRemPTPv2DelayMechanism.description: Shows the enabled PTPv2 delay mechanism

lldpXHmRemPTPClockValues.name: lldpXHmRemPTPClockValues
lldpXHmRemPTPClockValues.description: Shows, which clock type(s) are configured on a specific remote port and/or device: Bit (0) set to 1 indicates a slave clock Bit (1) set to 1 indicates a master clock Bit (2) set to 1 indicates a transparent clock Bit (3) set to 1 indicates a boundary clock Bit (4) set to 1 indicates a grandmaster clock Bit (5) set to 1 indicates a clock in multi domain mode Bit (6) set to 1 indicates a clock in simple mode If no PTP is configured, all bits should be set to 0.

lldpXHmRemPTPv2SubdomainNumber.name: lldpXHmRemPTPv2SubdomainNumber
lldpXHmRemPTPv2SubdomainNumber.description: Shows the PTPv2 subdomain number configured on the remote device. In case PTPv1 is configured, this value is of no relevance and will not be evaluated.

lldpXHmRemPTPv1SubdomainName.name: lldpXHmRemPTPv1SubdomainName
lldpXHmRemPTPv1SubdomainName.description: This Octet String contains the PTPv1 subdomain name, an ASCII String with a maximum of 16 characters length, configured on the remote device. If PTPv2 is configured, this field should be set to 0.
